item.title: Moxie, which helps nurses launch medspas, raises a preemptive Series B from Lachy Groom
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Moxie helps nurses open medspas by providing them with most of the tools they need to run their businesses, from billing software and marketing services to discounted supplies. The startup has raised a $10 million Series B led by existing investor Lachy Groom, a solo VC, with participation from SignalFire. The round comes only a […]

item.title: Data platform Airbyte can now create API connectors by reading the docs

item.description:
If your startup is only remotely related to working with data pipelines, you’re probably trying to figure out how to capitalize on the current moment: Enterprises are trying to figure out how to best use data to power generative AI products, and to do that, they need robust data services. item.title: Just 4 days left to save up to $600 on TechCrunch Disrupt 2024 passes
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
Time is running out to grab savings of up to $600 on individual tickets for TechCrunch Disrupt 2024! This limited-time offer ends on September 27 at 11:59 p.m. PT, so now’s your last opportunity to score a great deal before the final countdown begins. item.title: Tech YouTuber MKBHD’s Panels app is a bit underwhelming
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Tech YouTuber Marques Brownlee, or MKBHD, is stepping out of the reviewer role and into the mindset of a builder. This week, he launched a wallpaper app called Panels on iOS and Android, where he’s personally curating high-quality digital wallpapers from artists — but of course, there’s a catch. In order to access high-resolution wallpapers […]

item.title: As the open social web grows, a new nonprofit looks to expand the ‘fediverse’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
A new project launching today aims to capitalize on the momentum seen within the fediverse, also known as the open social web, which describes interconnected social networking services powered by the ActivityPub protocol. Co-founded by the co-author and current editor of ActivityPub, Evan Prodromou, a new nonprofit organization called the Social Web Foundation will focus […]

item.title: A startup from ex-Revolut employees uses AI to automate accounts — but hopes to keep accountants in jobs
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
Successful startups can give rise to “startup mafias” — groups of former founders who go on to create other startups. But at least as often, new startups can be founded by employees. In the case of LiveFlow, that’s exactly what happened — and it has now raised $13.5 million. A few years ago, Anita Koimur […]

item.title: Microsoft claims its new tool can correct AI hallucinations, but experts advise caution
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Microsoft today revealed Correction, a service that attempts to automatically revise AI-generated text that's factually wrong.

item.title: Sequoia’s first space investment since SpaceX is in sunlight-seller Reflect Orbital
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Imagine a future where the diurnal cycle, at least in some parts of the world, is adjustable. Where humans are no longer beholden to the 24-hour pattern of daylight and darkness. Instead of being constrained by the physical reality which constrains the sun to its daily cycle, imagine a future where the sun can be […]

item.title: TikTok comes for Google’s ad business as it starts letting advertisers target its search results page
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
After building out its Search product over the past few years to take on Google, TikTok is now taking its Search ambitions even further by allowing advertisers to target its search results page. TikTok announced on Tuesday that it’s launching the “TikTok Search Ads Campaign,” a new keyword-based search solution that enables brands to appear […]

item.title: Workera’s CEO was mentored by Andrew Ng. Now he wants an AI agent to mentor you
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Kian Katanforoosh has one of the best mentors in the AI world: renowned researcher Andrew Ng, who also served as his graduate school advisor at Stanford. The two went on to create Stanford’s deep learning program, and now, Ng serves as Chairman of Katanforoosh’s startup, Workera. Ng has been a meaningful guide in Katanforoosh’s career, […]

item.title: Spotify’s AI playlist feature rolls out to the U.S. and more markets
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Spotify has expanded the availability of its AI Playlist tool to the U.S., Canada, Ireland, and New Zealand after initially launching it for Premium subscribers in the U.K. and Australia.  This feature, currently in beta on Android and iOS devices, allows users to create personalized playlists based on written prompts. For instance, users can enter […]

item.title: Snapchat taps Google’s Gemini to power its chatbot’s generative AI features
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Snap has entered into an expanded partnership with Google Cloud to power generative AI experiences within Snapchat’s My AI chatbot. The chatbot will leverage the multimodal capabilities of Google’s Gemini AI to enable the chatbot to understand different types of information like text, audio, images, and videos. Gemini is powering the Google Lens-like features that […]

item.title: MoneyGram blames ‘cybersecurity issue’ for ongoing days-long outage
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The world's second largest money transfer provider said it doesn't have a timeline for when its services will return following a cyberattack.

item.title: Vista Equity Partners and Blackstone offer to buy Smartsheet for $8.4B in cash
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The private equity firms say that the deal values publicly traded Smartsheet's shares at a 41% premium over its 90-day average closing share price.

item.title: Fintech Mesa promises 1% cash back on mortgages, up to 3x on other home needs
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
Mortgage fintech Mesa has emerged from stealth on Tuesday with $9.2 million in seed capital and a novel idea for homeowners. It’s offering cash back and rewards on all spending done on the home, including the mortgage itself.  Mesa is offering mortgage loans, original or refinancing, that include a credit-card-style 1% cash back on the […]

item.title: Torq, which automates cybersecurity workflows, raises $70M in new capital
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
As the volume of cyberattacks grows, there’s increasing interest from the corporate sector in tech to help automate responses to breaches. Per a 2023 survey from analytics firm Devo, 80% of security leaders expected expanded investments in security automation technology this year; most cited the tech’s potential to support cyber threat mitigation. item.title: ByteDance is shutting down TikTok Music globally

Subscribers can continue to use the service until November 28, after which renewals will be automatically canceled.

item.title: Pinterest launches a feature to let users remix collages created by others
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Pinterest created an engaging format with collages last year, which allows users to combine images and cutouts to create new content. The company is now banking on people creating more of them by introducing a Remix feature. Just like the Remix feature on short video apps, such as Instagram and Snap, the idea behind Pinterest’s feature is […]

item.title: WP Engine sends cease-and-desist letter to Automattic over Mullenweg’s comments
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Mullenweg, who co-created WordPress, last week criticized WP Engine for raking in profits without giving much back to the open source project.
